title: Gauss–Manin connection
summary: In mathematics, the Gauss–Manin connection is a connection on a certain vector bundle over a base space S of a family of algebraic varieties V s {\displaystyle V_{s}} . The fibers of the vector bundle are the de Rham cohomology groups H D R k ( V s ) {\displaystyle H_{DR}^{k}(V_{s})} of the fibers V s {\displaystyle V_{s}} of the family. It was introduced by Yuri Manin (1958) for curves S and by Alexander Grothendieck (1966) in higher dimensions.
